Message.Text: Tommy, I don’t get why you’re still clinging to SQL. We’ve had this conversation so many times. NoSQL is the clear choice for this kind of project.
Clinging? Frank, it’s not clinging. SQL is the gold standard for a reason. And honestly, I’m tired of rehashing this NoSQL argument.
Every time I bring up NoSQL, you shut it down. I’m just trying to adapt to modern needs, and you’re making this harder than it has to be.
I’m not making it hard, Frank. I’m being practical. You’re always pushing NoSQL as if it’s the solution to everything, but it’s not.
It’s not everything, but it’s better for THIS project! Can we just agree to try it once instead of sticking with the same old SQL every time?
Fine, Frank. Let’s move on, but I still think you’re overhyping NoSQL. It’s not some magic fix.
